## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Iliya3ProX) reported an issue where the Long-Term Memory Engine (LTME) couldn't be turned on.

**Problems Identified:**

* When a downloaded local LLM exists, its state overrides saved selected models, leading to the LTME not being turned on.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team identified the root cause of the issue and implemented a fix.
* A patch was released on the same day to address the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of the patch.
* Users should be able to turn on the LTME as expected.

**Additional Details:**

* The user was offered helpful resources, including links to existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.
* The Pieces team requested Pieces OS logs for further investigation.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@brian-at-pieces) reports that Ollama install fails due to missing curl package.
* User (@ekuznetsov139) confirms having curl installed on Ubuntu.
* Manual Ollama installation doesn't fix the issue within Pieces.
* Problem identified: Pieces-OS is running in a sandboxed environment missing curl.

**Solutions:**

* User suggests patching to avoid requiring curl.
* User suggests adding curl to the list of dependency packages in the snap definition file.

**Current Status:**

* Patch for missing curl package under development.
* Solution for curl dependency in snap definition file not yet implemented.

**Outcome:**

* Issue remains open until a permanent solution is implemented.

**Additional Details:**

* User confirms having curl installed on Ubuntu.
* Manually installed Ollama runs successfully but is not recognized by Pieces.
* User suspects the issue stems from Pieces-OS sandboxed environment.

common_issues.title: Pieces App: UI/UX and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces app's UI/UX, including window resizing problems on macOS and layout issues on smaller screens. These are addressed in version 3.3.1. Additionally, there are reports of the app losing connection to PiecesOS, particularly on Windows, which is currently under investigation.

related_issues.text:
Unable to resize my pieces app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i am unable to resize the pieces app on my mac . i downloaded the app through link as it is not available on app store . i performend many ways to resize and called apple care for this and they have done troubleshooting from their after all that nothing has happend then they said that is from developer end . 

please resolve this problem as soon as possible so i can use peices app smoothly .
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Onboarding Window Size Issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users @ShashankKanaujia and @hra42 reported an issue with the onboarding window size being larger than intended on macOS 15.1 and 15.1.1.
* The issue was suspected to be a duplicate of #463.
* @mack-at-pieces investigated and confirmed the window size was intentionally locked during onboarding.
* However, it was agreed that the window size lock was no longer needed due to recent layout changes.

**Problems Identified:**

* Onboarding window displayed an extra-large size on macOS 15.1 and 15.1.1.
* Users were unable to resize the window.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the window size lock during onboarding.
* A patch release (3.3.1) was scheduled to address this issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch release (3.3.1) was deployed on December 19, 2024, resolving the issue.
* @ShashankKanaujia is expected to confirm the resolution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was not reproducible on other versions of macOS.
* The conversation shows effective collaboration and communication between the users and developer (@mack-at-pieces) to identify and resolve the issue.
* The issue was tracked through #504, which might be helpful for future reference.

related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

macOS

3.2.4

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** Pieces application interface is unusable on laptops with small screens due to elements being positioned off-screen.
* **Workaround:** User managed to continue by tabbing and clicking a hidden "Next" button.
* **Device:** Macbook Air 11 inch.

**Problems Identified:**

* Interface elements are not responsive and don't adjust to different screen sizes.
* This makes the application unusable for users with smaller screens.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Solution 1:** Implement responsive design for interface elements to adjust to different screen sizes. (**Implemented**)
* **Solution 2:** Allow users to resize the window during onboarding. (**Implemented**)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue has been resolved with version 3.3.1 of the application.
* The application now detects available window size and adjusts accordingly, or allows resizing during onboarding.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue was a duplicate of #470.
* The developer team appreciated the user's report and patience.
